query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Ethical issues report
result.description: This report describes the compliance of the project and related activities to ethical principles. This deliverable is linked to T8.2.

project.title: Sustainability Transition Assessment Rules for Bio-Based Systems

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: International and EU sustainability certification schemes for bio-based systems

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Educational program material
result.description: Educational program material. We will generate student material and a teacher’s guide for usage aimed at ages 10-14. Versions will be produced to match the ecosystems and school context in the partner locations, including publication in Spanish, Dutch, Romanian, Norwegian bokmål, Estonian, and Greek. Task 3.1, M32

result.description: Educational program template. We will generate a template for the educational program in English, that will outline its content sections. result.title: Report on existing monitoring schemes, with recommendations for new system
result.description: This report provides an overview of existing monitoring schemes, for assessing the effectiveness of B2B labels and Certificaiton schemes. It will also provide recommendations on importnat features to be included in a new monitoring system.

project.title: Sustainability Transition Assessment Rules for Bio-Based Systems

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: International and EU sustainability certification schemes for bio-based systems

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.title: Certification, Verification, Validation, Technical Compliance, Standards
Sustainable design (for recycling, for environment, eco-design)
Protection of environment (before, during and after)

result.title: Report on existing international and EU SCS and B2B labels for feedstock and bio-based materials & products
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Tasks 1.2 and 1.3. Specifically, it will present findings obtained by reviewing and analysing existing international and EU SCS and B2B labels for feedstock and bio-based materials & products. The review will focus on peer-reviewed papers and reports from the grey literature, databases, and EU as well as international web sources.

result.title: Concept of the monitoring system
result.description: Thie report will provide a concept for the monitoring system. It will inlcude the results of a co-creation workshop and analysis with initial decisions about how the monitoring system will be structured, what content it will cover, and what kind of final ranking or result it will produce. This report will then form the basis of the further testing and design of the monitoring system.
